file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 53-23-03-04 - PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE HATCH STOP - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE HATCH STOP - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the passenger-cabin escape hatch stop. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 53-23-03-000-801-A ESCAPE HATCH STOP - REMOVAL ALL 53-23-03-400-801-A ESCAPE HATCH STOP - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 53-23-03 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 53-23-03-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. ESCAPE HATCH STOP - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the passenger-cabin escape hatch stop. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-22-01-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-22-02-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-23-08-000-801-A/400 ESCAPE-HATCH TRIM SHROUD - REMOVAL AMM TASK 52-21-00-000-801-A/400 PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE HATCHES - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 812 LH Passenger-cabin escape hatch 822 RH Passenger-cabin escape hatch D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To tighten the screws available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task On the escape hatch door, RH/LH EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 53-23-03 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-004-A (1) Remove the passenger-cabin escape hatch ( AMM TASK 52-21-00-000-801-A/400). (2) Remove the escape-hatch trim shroud (AMM TASK 25-23-08-000-801-A/400). (3) Remove the passenger service unit (PSU): • For RH PSU (AMM TASK 25-22-02-000-801-A/400). • For LH PSU (AMM TASK 25-22-01-000-801-A/400). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-004-A (1) Remove the nut (6), washer (5), and bolt (12). (2) Remove the stop (4) and the shim (11). (3) Remove the shaft (7) as follows: (a) Remove the nut (1), washer (2), and shaft (7). (b) Remove the bushing (3). (c) Remove the bolt (10). (d) Remove the washer (9). (e) Remove the bushing (8). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 53-23-03 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Passenger-Cabin Escape Hatch Stop Figure 401 STA 15073.6 STA 14513.6 B 1 A ZONES 812 822 2 1. NUT DET. A 2. WASHER 3. BUSHING 9. BOLT SKIN (REF.) 4. STOP 5. WASHER 8. SHIM 6. NUT DET. B 7. SHAFT 2 8. BUSHING 9. WASHER 1 TORQUE: 11.3 - 15.8 N.m (100 - 140 lb.in). 2 10. BOLT APPLY AEROSHELL GREASE 7. 3 3 APPLY LOCTITE 241. EM145AMM530282B.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 53-23-03 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 53-23-03-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. ESCAPE HATCH STOP - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the passenger-cabin escape hatch stop. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-22-01-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-22-02-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-23-08-400-801-A/400 ESCAPE-HATCH TRIM SHROUD - INSTALLATION PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE HATCHES - INSTAL- AMM TASK 52-21-00-400-801-A/400 LATION IPC 53-23-00 CENTRAL III C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 812 LH Passenger-cabin escape hatch 822 RH Passenger-cabin escape hatch D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To tighten the screws available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MIL-PRF-23827 Aeroshell Grease 7 AR ASTM D 4080 Thrichloethylene Solvent AR MEP09-005 Anaerobic Adhesive - Type II (Loctite 241) AR EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 53-23-03 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Central III IPC 53-23-00 AR H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task On the escape hatch door, RH/LH I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-004-A (1) Clean the parts and the applicable area with the thrichloethylene solvent. (2) Install the shaft (7) as follows: (a) Apply Aeroshell Grease 7 to the bushing (8), and soak the bolt (10) with Loctite 241. (b) Install the bushing (8), washer (9), and (10). (c) Apply Aeroshell Grease 7 to the bushing (3) and install it. (d) Put the shaft (7) into the bushing (3). (e) Install the washer (2) and the nut (1). (f) Tighten the nut (1) to 11.3 - 15.8 N.m (100 - 140 lb.in). (3) Put the shim (11) and the stop (4) in position against the fuselage. (4) Install the bolt (12), washer (5), and nut (6). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-004-A (1) Install the passenger service unit (PSU): • For RH PSU (AMM TASK 25-22-02-400-801-A/400). • For LH PSU (AMM TASK 25-22-01-400-801-A/400). (2) Instal the escape-hatch trim shroud (AMM TASK 25-23-08-400-801-A/400). (3) Install the passenger-cabin escape hatch ( AMM TASK 52-21-00-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 53-23-03 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
